definitions.definition: a series of performances of music, plays, films, etc., usually organized in the same place once a year; a series of public events connected with a particular activity or idea

examples.text: The pub is holding its **annual** beer **festival** later this week.
a rock festival *(= where bands perform, often outdoors and over a period of several days)*
He's appearing at a local folk festival tonight.
I like to play any big festivals.
The dance troupe will open the festival on June 13.
The festival attracts thousands of visitors every year.
The school has taken part in the festival since 2022.
a festival featuring five local bands
the events in this year's festival
the movies shown during the eight-day festival

definitions.definition: a day or period of the year when people stop working to celebrate a special event, often a religious one

examples.text: The family always celebrates the Jewish festivals.
the pilgrims who arrived on major festivals
festivals held in honour of local saints
Holi, the Hindu festival to welcome spring

wordOrigin: Middle English (as an adjective): via Old French from medieval Latin festivalis, from Latin festivus, from festum, (plural) festa ‘feast’.
